N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17ยง 2.4 - Collection of information

State Regulations
(a) Personal information shall be collected directly from data subjects whenever
practicable except when collected for the purpose of making quasi-judicial
determinations. (b) Each data
subject who is requested to supply information to be maintained in a record
shall be provided with a notice containing the following information: the name of the subdivision of the department requesting the
personal information and the name or title of the system of records in which
such information will be maintained; the title, business address and telephone number of the
department official who is responsible for the system of records; the authority granted by law which authorizes the collection
and maintenance of personal information; the effects, if any, upon such data subject of not providing
all or part of the information requested; the principal purpose or purposes for which information is to
be collected; and the uses which may be made of the information pursuant to
paragraphs (b), (c), (f) of subdivision 1 of section
96
of the

Public Officers Law. Notes
